definition: lit. to shake one's body/refers to abrupt transformation/same as 搖身一變|摇身一变
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life

sentences.english: What starts as criticism of the foreign can quickly swing to domestic targets.
sentences.chinese: 对于外国的批判可以很快摇身一变指向内部的目标。

sentences.english: Reno has turned itself into a distribution hub.
sentences.chinese: 如雷诺市已经摇身一变成为了集散中心。

sentences.english: The boring office guy transforms into a passionate lover of giving oral sex.
sentences.chinese: 无趣的公司职员摇身一变成了口技了得的情场浪子。

sentences.english: Erh-lang turned into a huge sea crane and pursued the crow.
sentences.chinese: 二郎神急抖翎毛，摇身变作大海鹤，钻上云霄来啄。

definition: to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
to change into/to turn into/to become
remarkably alike
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
incarnation/reincarnation/embodiment (of abstract idea)/personification
bird shotgun replaced by cannon (idiom); equipment improved enormously
just like/solemn/dignified/neatly laid out
to be done/to be ready/that's enough!/that will do!
(lit. and fig.) overnight
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to sink (into ruin, oblivion)/to be reduced to
remarkably alike
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to turn into
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
